^[_a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*$.description: Each entry defines a configuration. The key is its name. Valid properties are `components` and `config-path`.

steps.description:
An array of the components to be used. A component can be used multiple times for multi-node setup.
They will be started in the order of the array.

use.description:
The name of the component to use. It refers to the templates defined in the top-level `template` section.
Other key-value pairs here will be used to override the template's default values.
A component can be used multiple times for multi-node setup.

config-path.description:
The path to `risingwave.toml` for this configuration.
It will be copied to `.risingwave/config/risingwave.toml` , which will be used for execution.

template.description: Component configuration templates referred by the `use` field in the above `risedev` section.

^[_a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9_-]*$.description:
Each entry defines a component configuration template. The key is the component's name. The value is a map of the component's configuration.
You can use variables like `id: compute-node-${port}` and wildcards like `provide-compute-node: "compute-node*"`. Refer to https://github.com/risingwavelabs/risingwave/blob/main/src/risedevtool/README.md#config-expander for more details.

user-managed.description: If true, this service will be started by user with the above config.

id.description: Id of this instance. It will be used to expand wildcards.

provide-.*.description: Provide other components' configs to this component. Refer to https://github.com/risingwavelabs/risingwave/blob/main/src/risedevtool/README.md#component-provision for more details.
